title: ICE: when using Path::from(format!(...))

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.

http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/

-->

### Code

```Rust
let extension = library_path
        .extension()
        .unwrap()
        .to_str()
        .unwrap()
        .to_string()
        .remove(0);
    debug!("Library extension: {}", extension);
    let file_name = Path::from(format!(
        "{}-libmirrord_layer.{extension:?}",
        Alphanumeric
            .sample_string(&mut rand::thread_rng(), 10)
            .to_lowercase()
    ));
    let file_path = match dest_dir {
        Some(dest_dir) => std::path::Path::new(&dest_dir).join(file_name),
        None => temp_dir().as_path().join(file_name),
    };
```


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
mehula@mehul-machine:~/mirrord$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.65.0-nightly (b44197abb 2022-09-05)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: b44197abb0b3ffe4908892e1e08ab1cd721ff3b9
commit-date: 2022-09-05
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.65.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.0
```
